intro: Campanula dichotoma var. leptosiphon, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features slender, upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is a popular choice for native plant gardens.
